page.title: 03FARMING..CROPS (GENERAL)
page.content: In the 1980s we can see that the main land use is arable farming and this type of farming will undoubtedly continue into the forseeable future.Crops being grown during 1985 include spring barley,winter barley, wheat,grass for hay,potatoes,turnips, kale,oil seed rape and field vegetables.With a barley and wheat glut in the U.K. and resulting fall in prices, farmers may switch to other crops in years to come in an attempt to maintain profit levels.With the E.E.C. encouraging the growth of protein crops,which they are heavily subsidising,the farmers are turning to oil seed rape, peas, lupins and beans thus cutting down our import bill running into billions of pounds.
